q: Investigator: Wait To See If Michael Vick Has Changed ESPN.com- The man who led the U.S. government's investigation of Michael Vick 's dogfighting case said that he's withholding judgment on the quarterback's rehabilitation. Do I think he's changed? I don't know, said retired U.S. Department of Agriculture senior special agent Jim Knorr, speaking to ESPN's Outside The Lines. "I would hope he has but I don't know. Only one person knows and that's him

Nokia, on the stage to talk briefly about the new agreement between the companies. Last week Nokia announced that it would phase out Symbian and start making smartphones that run Windows Phone software. The world is shifting from a battle of devices to a war of ecosystems, Stephen Elop said, reiterating a statement Steve Ballmer made earlier. who accuses the tabloid of hacking her messages. While lawyers say more celebrities are about to accuse journalists of hacking their phones, Deputy Tony Blair Nick Clegg sought to draw a line under the controversy. I don't think this government will miss a beat in terms of just pressing ahead with the plan that we have set out for the next four and a half years, he told the BBC. " Andy Coulson has been very clear that he was not in any way responsible for phone hacking or had any knowledge of it. I have no reason to disbelieve him."

been burned for three straight games of at least 40 points by the 76ers All-Star. "Honestly, they play me one-on-one, straight up," Allen Iverson said of a Bucks' defense he penetrated at will. Except in the last quarter. I guess they felt like they had to do something. By then, it was too late. Allen Iverson reached 40 points against the Bucks for the sixth time in his career, his most against any opponent. He had 40 and 54 points in his previous two games

"Hi, I'm Simon Cowell and I was born to be a pain in the a***," he said, adding: I'm backing Save The Children's campaign No Child Born To Die because around the world each year, eight million children die of preventable causes. Actress Brenda Blethyn said she was "born to sing" but never got around to it, while Spooks star Hermione Norris confessed she was "born to eat sweets". DJ Edith Bowman is "born

somebody like Beyonce: She is the best example of somebody who works it every hour of the day," he said. Simon Cowell , as American Idol viewers know, doesn't lack for confidence: I believe I can find a star, he said. He has seen only a few minutes of this season's American Idol and its reconstituted panel with Steven Tyler , Jennifer Lopez and Randy Jackson, he said.

criminal activity January 2011- CPS to review all material held by police, following civil action launched against the NoW by actress Sienna Miller . Mr Andy Coulson resigns as prime minister's communications chief In a statement NoW said: We have carried out an extensive investigation led by a team of independent forensic specialists and we have found no evidence whatsoever to support this allegation. "The civil litigation is ongoing, as is the internal investigation and until both are concluded it would be inappropriate to comment further. "However, we are disappointed the BBC chose to lead with this misleading report without giving the News of the World an opportunity to respond. The Guardian has previously reported that Mr Evans' defence is he phoned Ms Kelly Hoppen 's number for legitimate reasons and accidentally accessed her voicemail when the keys on his own phone got stuck. me. You're a pro. You're a hell of a lot better than others in this town." Howard Kurtz suspects that Donald Rumsfeld 's goal with this memoir is to leave readers with the same conclusion. But it contains few surprises and, after so many years of divisive debate, is unlikely to change many minds, writes Howard Kurtz . "What is known is that he has in these 50 chapters marshaled his best defense; only history's final verdict remains unknown." Donald Rumsfeld , that master of the tart zinger,... Photo
